data.title: Display what line is causing the error on Duality log

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Instead of just telling the user that there's something wrong with a function, Duality should also tell the user which line, exactly, is causing the issue.

However, I don't think that it's possible...

data.title: Parsing Xml Documentation Bug

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
When I installed a Frozen Plugin from the Package Manager, on next start Dualitor crashed, so I looked to the source code and found that the exception was caused by an null argument in class XmlCodeDoc.
![bugscreen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4572155/5389826/6ff3ea1a-811c-11e4-9f95-f0e55d23462b.png)
To fix it I added a simple check:  
![fix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4572155/5389878/110c5054-811d-11e4-8538-f72cefc175c9.png)
Of course it's not solving the source of the problem.

data.title: Automatic Viewport Scaling to Target Size / Resolution

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
## Problem:
- Certain games are designed to use a fixed resolution.
- The resolution on a user device might be entirely different.
## Solution:
- Similar to this: https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/2cb48ed12a585e39168ed3f0749e0284ecd45248
- A Camera should allow to specify a NominalViewportSize and optional viewport scaling.
- When active, viewport scaling should scale everything during rendering in order to display the exact same screen area, just "bigger" or "smaller", while also maintaining aspect ratio.
  - This **should** apply when rendering from world to screen. (Nominal fit screen)
  - This **should** apply when rendering from world to texture. (Nominal fit texture)
  - This **should** apply when rendering from texture to screen. (Texture fit screen)
  - This **should not** apply when rendering from texture to texture, as these are internal renderpasses that are likely configured carefully and should not be disturbed.
- Everything outside the nominal viewport (but inside the target rect) should be black.

data.title: Add a "Select Object" Button next to Reference Editors

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- DragDrop is neat, but sometimes it just takes longer to search for the object in Scene or Project View than to simply open up a new window, enter a search term and select it.
- This button might replace the existing "highlight" button, because there's no space left. Maybe make the highlight button "optional", so that it only shows up when there's enough space?
- Open up a new window
  - Contains a flat list of applicable objects
  - Search field, focused by default
  - List is sorted by "match score" with the search field contents plus "most recently used score"
  - Hitting the return key on the reference property editor will open up the window. Hitting the return key in the window will select the topmost list item and accept it immediately. No mouse interaction required!
- Refactor the Create Object dialog to be actually a special case of this one, just with Types as "objects".

data.title: Improve Source/Media Folder Handling

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Right now, `Source/Media` is mostly a temp-like wasteland, because it isn't kept in sync with the Data directory properly.
- It doesn't have to be like this, since this would be an ideal place to store actual source data and even put it into version control. It could be an "optionally temporary" folder, that can or can not be used, depending on preference.
## ToDo
- Allow importing Resources from source files that are already located within `Source/Media`.
- Keep the source folder in sync with the data folder at all times.
- Keep it optional like it is now: If someone was to delete the source folder, it shouldn't be a problem at all.

data.title: Texture Compression Support

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
- Textures need to use a certain data format. Just set it automatically when handling compressed data.
- Pixmaps need to store a compressed version of their data in a separate layer.
  - The uncompressed layer should be restorable from the compressed one, in case uncompressed data was discarded upon release, but editing capabilities should still be preserved.
- It's been done here using libsquish: https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/2d275ac71dbab61cddeca98b6512375bfb68c7c0
  - Uses managed wrapper around unmanaged library. Don't do it like that. Remain purely managed.
  - Search for alternatives.

data.title: Refactor CamViewState To Be More Extensible

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
Currently, CamViewStates are limited to a predefined set of actions that can be performed on selected or hovered objects. Also, the code has become quite cluttered with specific checks for individual actions. This is all not very nice. See what can be done to improve the situation.
- Have a distinct class for each action that can be performed, similar to this? https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/ab46ccd9119e92ee68db639a3b35ee0bacbda6d3
- Refactor SelObj itself as well?
- Ideally, it would be possible for an editor plugin to just add a new action to an existing state.
- Also, view this in context of the [RigidBody Editor Improvements](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/54) to come.

data.title: Introduce Static Guard Class

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Introduce a static Guards class to check for various error conditions inspired by this one: https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/aa3e925f3a63891b596b414478cca2075e2d330c
- All Guards should be equipped with conditional attributes, so there is no overhead for certain kinds of builds.
- Use `[Conditional("DEBUG"), Conditional("GUARDS")]`, so debug builds are always guarded, but release builds can be too when defining `GUARDS` manually in the build settings - which is useful when shipping Duality as a release build, but still wanting it to be guarded.
- Replace all of the usual "early-out exceptions" thrown in Duality methods with Guards calls. Only replace the typical parameter checking stuff - not actual exceptions, as this isn't really a "guard" case.
  - Remember (and make it clear in the docs) that the purpose of Guards is to enforce and check for a certain state and prior to performing an operation. They are **not** the right choice when something goes actually wrong _during_ said operation.
- Guards should throw an exception by default, so they're easily debuggable.

data.title: Introduce BatCat Improvements

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
The guys from BatCat games have been introducing a lot of nice additions, tweaks and fixes to their local Duality fork. Let's see if some of them can be introduced back into Duality:
## Quick Merge / Fix

Mostly trivial merges that don't need much work to fit in just well.
- [x] Allow screen resolution changes at runtime. https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/29b28280559a53d742777ab2338c4fcbea07ea7d
- [x] QueryRectGlobal Bugfix. Apparently, it makes a difference which AABB constructor is used. Doublecheck the actual behavior. https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/9e151fbc5e8c2dd26d475931cbdde592b8105fdf
  - The difference is actually center-origin vs. topleft origin in the rect specified via parameters. This can't be changed without altering Duality behavior and is in fact not a simple fix, but rather a "different overload" of the same functionality. The same behavior can be achieved by offsetting the worldCoord parameter by -size/2. Keeping the method as is, because topleft+size is the intuitive way to specify rectangles.
- [x] CamView Keyboard shortcuts 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/e12fd9946a705213f72ca3dbec19b7b42cf85552
- [x] Switch from List to HashSet inside GameObjectManager for performance reasons 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/5c557938b7198a2aa09cb6e882190bd68dcdc6c0
- [x] Check Bugfix 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/cc0c5ae15774e6b35b31fce9d91bc72ffa70a0e5
- [x] Check Bugfix 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/effbcb568a89cdc3cef52fa4c46e81f7685d2e24
- [x] Remove the "Are You Sure" dialog on closing when there are no changes anyway 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/61249ae7dbf0cbcbb1e0c9a8c98755c65a221240
- [x] Startup performance tweaking related to CamView BgColorDialog 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/6942f49ffb64aa1e6fa9b4aa9d09d9a6ccbea317
- [x] FileHash performance improvements 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/6df39273f5356c8868acf1748d3877af6d5ff868
- [x] Startup performance tweaks for .Net 4.5 (research this first)
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/02f282e70bbfae4fdb24f32518587ca4a9941962
  - Moved [here](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/106)
## Needs Work

Useful stuff that needs to be modified or partially re-evaluated before merging.
- [x] Support for games with a fixed aspect ratio via viewport scaling: https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/2cb48ed12a585e39168ed3f0749e0284ecd45248
  - Doesn't work for all cases with this implementation. Definitely a thing that Duality should have, but this will need more work. Moved to separate issue.
- [x] Look into why loading Scenes without initializing them can trigger loading of Prefabs.
  - Can't reproduce. Look out for it in the future, but may have been fixed inadvertedly due to the big version gap.
- [x] Pixmap Performance Improvements https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/d59d14e7cf9132c3bcba6139f566eba33aafe801
- [x] Introduce a way for Duality to detect whether its application is in the background / unfocused. Think of features like Auto-Pause when Alt-Tabbing.
- [x] Fonts could have an IncludeFamilyData option to allow ones created inside the editor to include all the required data within the Resource, similar to Fonts dragged into the editor from a .ttf file.
  - Low priority, pure usability / convenience feature. There are more important things to do right now, but keep this in mind for later.
- [x] Highlight objects when double-clicking log entries https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/e20362937a55841b4d9342cdc2c90db0df295170
- [x] Move hierarchial context menu creation to a central place. Check if this hasn't been refactored anyway in the meantime: 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/e282d9e1b4fd6e62e58528670080c892e4d2c560
- [x] Use a more performant way to remove null objects / flush them at the end of the frame without re-allocating the underlying containers 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/54fd09f7717ff09b35d2d092e94efcbd53f2cdb6
- [x] Consider introducing a mechanism for custom visibility checking for renderers 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/9ba93fea4883ee250121428e0e3576762f288a4c
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/32a7159727b71587c42e216d5fef0bd98e7a32e4
- [x] Consider Camera event hooks for frame and pass completion (Custom screen capture, node editor preview, graphics debugging) 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/3c70e697d56a9caafcca9106f419342695c406aa
  - Seems too specialized to introduce into the core right now. Re-evaluate later.
- [x] Improve CamView handling of Transforms for objects that do not have renderers. Display a gizmo and make sure there is a minimum size assumed so mouse input works.
  - Low-priority. Deal with this the next time when doing work in the CamView / CamViewState classes.
- [x] ContentRef selection button like in Unity (Flat list with search box, no hierarchy)
  - Moved to separate issue.
## Future Ideas

Open for consideration. Move to separate Issues later when doing concept work.

_Edit: Moved them all to separate issues_
- [x] Refactor the CamViewState to allow introducing custom actions: https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/ab46ccd9119e92ee68db639a3b35ee0bacbda6d3
- [x] Introduce Guards to Duality? 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/aa3e925f3a63891b596b414478cca2075e2d330c
- [x] At some point, there should be texture compression somehow 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/2d275ac71dbab61cddeca98b6512375bfb68c7c0
- [x] Allow to drag around / modify RigidBody shape vertices. Likely not exactly this, but something conceptually similar: 
  https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/a9ed27a7f04fc791b060ba5cd738862652ad0307
- [x] Workspace presets: Multiple customizable docking settings for the user to quickly switch between.
- [x] Improve Source/Media folder handling. Allow importing stuff directly from there and also keep those files in sync, so Source/Media can properly be checked into source control to improve Asset workflow.

(Thanks to @BraveSirAndrew for basically walking me through all of their commit history since February!)

data.title: DualityEditor "crashes" on error while reading plugin xml documentation with generic parameters

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Launching DualityEditor with the following xml document as plugin documentation
http://pastebin.com/9hxfHd8C
will cause an exception to occur in XmlCodeDoc.ResolveDocStyleMember (line 290 in the head revision), due to the fact that, on line 280, paramTypes[i] could not be correctly determined.

This causes windows to play the error sound, DualityEditor's process remains alive but the main window is never displayed. The only solution is to kill the process.

The line in the xml that causes the issue is line 1177

data.title: Simplify If Statement GameObject Parent & Remove Middleman

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Change 0/4: Use of a static class for constants

Since every resource class has a file extension that is hard coded as an attribute, the goal is to use them as global variables grouped into a single static class. Hence, it is easier to make modifications to these variables from a single static class instead of going into each class to change it.

Change 0/1: Refactor If Statement Conditions for GameObject Parent

Instead of having comments to explain what the piece of code inside the if statement does, the block was extracted into a method with a specific name which allows a better comprehension of the actions performed.

Change 0/7: Remove Middleman

Since the scene is hiding internal details (Game Objects) to the rest of the world, a lot of methods are delated to the GameObjectManager class. Our solution is to remove the middleman (GameObjectManager). The scene will be able to manipulate its own list of GameObjects without having to go through the GameObjectManager. A new interface will also be implemented in order to manage GameObjects if there is any other class that needs it.

data.title: Improve Package Browsing

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
The current version of the Package Manager Frontend isn't very good at letting the user browse packages.
- The TreeView should include some more columns that get visible once a certain minimum size is reached.
  - Last Updated
  - Dependencies
  - Something else?
- By default, the view should be sorted by "Last Updated"

data.title: DrawDevice finalizer causes AccessViolationException

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: This is a fairly esoteric issue but if you let an instance of the Camera component fall out of scope without forcing it's OnShutdown method to run in the Deativate context, its DrawDevice finalizer will be called, which of course runs on the finalizer thread, but the DrawDevice.Dispose method must run on the main thread so that it can delete the VBO.

data.title: Windows DPI Awareness

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body: A lot of the editor seems to display and render things incorrectly or cut off when you change the DPI of windows. My MacBook Pro runs at 2880x1800 at a native resolution but thats far to small to read anything so I increased my DPI to "Larger - 150%" under "Control Panel\All Control Panel Items\Display".

data.title: Add Diagnostic System Specs to Logfile

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Duality Logfiles can be a big help in debugging crashes on non-dev systems. They could be even more helpful if there was some default system information written in them at all times:
- Operating System Name and Version
- Framework Name and Version
- OpenGL Capability Level and Stats, Shading Language Version
- GPU Vendor and Name
- CPU Vendor and Name

data.title: Silent Fail to Create Project on Low Disk Space

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I just downloaded Duality and was trying to follow the tutorial to get started.  Apparently, Duality copies all its files to the new location (is this correct?).

The user selects the project template, name and destination folder.  If there is not enough space at the destination, you hear the Windows error sound but the editor doesn't give you any feedback.  Subsequent attempts to create a project result in empty directories.

data.title: Performance Testing

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: All performances of game engine aspects must be tested. We need to know how big and complex projects we can make with this game engine! For example, can be used in a real time strategy game and what is the amount of sprites that it can be rendered!

data.title: Deal with ICmpInitializable.OnInit

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
- Having to check for the context parameter is counter-intuitive and a newbie pitfall.
- In 99% of cases, what the user really wants is just an OnActivate / OnDeactivate
- Consider splitting ICmpInitializable into multiple interfaces, where ICmpInitializable will just deal with activation states.
  - Might keep the OnInit / OnShutdown naming to not throw everyone off the track.
- Also, evaluate which of those are really needed. Get rid of all others.

data.title: Fix Scene.SwitchTo Unit Test

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: - It fails. Take at look at the reasons and fix it.

data.title: Adding a security measure to avoid crashes during file import

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As described here http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=18&t=292&start=10#p1223

in some cases the editor will crash while trying to import, for example, a malformed image file.
This fixes the issue by trapping the error and logging the exception in the editor's log.

data.title: Added support for multiple NuGet repositories.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I added support for multiple NuGet repositories defined in PackageConfig.xml. So it now can looks like this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<PackageConfig>
  <RepositoryUrl>https://packages.nuget.org/api/v2</RepositoryUrl>
  <RepositoryUrl>D:\LocalNuGet</RepositoryUrl>
  <Packages />
</PackageConfig>

This is handy when you are developing some plugins and you want to keep them internal or just test them from internal repository before submitting them to nuget.org.

The save and load methods were changed only little bit here it looks like I change them whole. I guess it is because some difference between spaces/tabs in my Visual Studio.

I changed the format in which the urls are stored. Original url was directly converted to Uri but also keep in the string. I am saving urls only as a strings and do same conversion right before the repository is created. I am not sure if the public property RepositoryUrl was already used somewhere but when I changed it to RepositoryUrls everything seems to be fine.

data.title: Make AdamsLair.Duality NuGet-Compatible outside Duality
data.body: See [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=1197#p1197)

data.title: Allow Destructive RigidBody CopyData
data.body:
Right now, RigidBody implements a clone method that doesn't allow having less shapes or joints than the original. This needs to change. Also, there should be a unit test to check for this.

Symptoms: Can't clone a RigidBody without shapes.

data.title: Consider Upgrading to Farseer 3.5

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body: Right now, Duality uses Farseer 3.3. Upgrading to Farseer Physics 3.5 might yield performance, memory usage and physics behavior improvements. However, there are [certain unresolved issues](https://farseerphysics.codeplex.com/workitem/34553) in Farseer 3.5 that require further investigation.

data.title: Allow To Tweak Farseer Settings

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: Allow developers to tweak Farseer Settings in DualityAppData. This might be really useful for certain physics-heavy games.

data.title: Investigate Triple Buffering?
data.body: See if it is easily possible to support triple buffering using OpenTK. If it is and yields notable improvements in smooth graphics display, allow to activate it via DualityUserData.

data.title: Option to not load OpenAl

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description: "Coming Soon" Stuff that would introduce too many or too severe breaking changes to be released in anything less than a major version step.

data.body:
Hi there

This is super low priority but, I though I would document it anyway. (also it might be there already and in that case it would be great to know)

It is always possible that people will be using something like FMod or WWise for sound, it would be nice if there was a configuration option so that openAL is not used in Duality .
I am sure that adds some extra loading and starting time. 

Seems kind of trivial to not create the SoundDevice on DualityApp.OnInt() but a little bit more to check that is not used if the device is not there :D

data.title: Auto-Compile Game Code after Package Update

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: As mentioned [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=294), it would be really nice if the Duality Package Manager would also compile local game plugins after updating packages.

data.title: AccessViolationException when Remote Desktop
data.body:
When I am trying to run editor and I am connected via Remote Desktop to my machine it throws following exception:

```
System.AccessViolationException was unhandled by user code
  HResult=-2147467261
  Message=Attempted to read or write protected memory. This is often an indication that other memory is corrupt.
  Source=OpenTK
  StackTrace:
       at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CreateProgram()
       at Duality.Resources.ShaderProgram.AttachShaders(ContentRef`1 v, ContentRef`1 f) in d:\Duality\Source\Duality\Resources\ShaderProgram.cs:line 200
       at Duality.Resources.ShaderProgram..ctor(ContentRef`1 v, ContentRef`1 f) in d:\Duality\Source\Duality\Resources\ShaderProgram.cs:line 180
       at Duality.Resources.ShaderProgram.InitDefaultContent() in d:\Duality\Source\Duality\Resources\ShaderProgram.cs:line 61
       at Duality.ContentProvider.InitDefaultContent() in d:\Duality\Source\Duality\ContentProvider.cs:line 52
       at Duality.Editor.DualityEditorApp.Init(MainForm mainForm, Boolean recover) in d:\Duality\Source\DualityEditor\DualityEditorApp.cs:line 240
       at Duality.Editor.Forms.SplashScreen.InitEditor() in d:\Duality\Source\DualityEditor\Forms\SplashScreen.cs:line 24
  InnerException: 
```

Maybe it could be someting in the OpenTK. I found this: https://github.com/opentk/opentk/issues/35

data.title: Prefab link changes ignore component type when setting ActiveSingle
data.body:
Hi Adam

Found a bug in the PrefabLink.PopChanges method. Create a prefab from a game object with two or more components on it, then try and change the active status of two or more of those components. PopChanges will remove any previous ActiveSingle changes because it doesn't check the component type of each existing change, only the property.

I've committed a fix to our fork but we're quite out of sync now so I'm having trouble creating a clean pull request. Our fix is here https://github.com/BraveSirAndrew/duality/commit/0351f3a38838125af7f501146a93cf9a76f532cc.

Thanks
